question: Which of the following schemes envisages organising traditional industries and artisans in the country into clusters in order to make them competitive for their long-term sustainability or employment?
explanation: SFURTI stands for Scheme of Fund for Up-gradation and Regeneration of Traditional Industries (SFURTI). The objective of the scheme is to organise traditional industries and artisans into clusters to make them competitive and provide support for their long-term sustainability or sustained employment. It aims to strengthen the cluster governance systems with the active participation of the stakeholders and to build up innovative products, improved technologies, advanced processes, market intelligence and new models of public-private partnerships. This scheme also helps micro and small enterprises (MSE) clusters to enhance marketability of products with design interventions, improved packaging and infrastructure. Under Scheme for Fund for Regeneration of Traditional Industries (SFURTI), the budgetary allocation has increased from Rs 10 crore in BE 2017-18 to Rs 125 crore in BE 2018-19.
